{{Distinguish|Rob Elliott|Robbie Elliott}} {{Use British English|date=August 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=December 2017}} <!--HE HAS HAD TWO DIFFERENT LOAN PERIODS AT ACCRINGTON, PLEASE DO NOT COMBINE THESE--> {{Infobox football biography | name = Rob Elliot | image = Rob Elliot.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Elliot with [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in 2013 | fullname = Robert Elliot<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=15 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1986|4|30|df=y}}<ref name="Hugman2010/11">{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-601-0 |page= 137}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Greenwich]], England | height = 1.90 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/2214/Robert-Elliot/overview |title=Robert Elliot |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=27 August 2017}}</ref> | position = [[Goalkeeper (association football)|Goalkeeper]] | currentclub = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | clubnumber = 1 | youthyears1 = |youthclubs1 = [[Erith Town F.C.|Erith Town]] | youthyears2 = |youthclubs2 = [[Charlton Athletic F.C. Academy|Charlton Athletic]] | years1 = 2004–2011 |clubs1 = [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]] |caps1 = 96 |goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2004 |clubs2 = → [[Bishop's Stortford F.C.|Bishop's Stortford]] (loan) |caps2 = 6 |goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2005 |clubs3 = → [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]] (loan) |caps3 = 4 |goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2005–2006 |clubs4 = → [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] (loan) |caps4 = 23 |goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2006–2007 |clubs5 = → [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]] (loan) |caps5 = 7 |goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2011– |clubs6 = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] |caps6 = 55 |goals6 = 0<!-- LEAGUE GAMES ONLY - When you update this parameter, please update the club-update parameter! --> | nationalyears1 = 2004 | nationalteam1 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team|Republic of Ireland U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014– | nationalteam2 = [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 21:38, 27 December 2017 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 21:38, 27 August 2017 (UTC) }} '''Robert Elliot''' (born 30 April 1986) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] and the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland national team]].
Elliot began his career with [[Erith Town F.C.|Erith Town]], before joining [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]]'s [[Charlton Athletic F.C. Academy|academy side]]. Whilst at Charlton, he was sent out on loan to [[Bishop's Stortford F.C.|Bishop's Stortford]] and [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]], and also spent two loan spells at [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]], where he was nicknamed "The Dilsh". He would then go on to be Charlton's first choice goalkeeper for a number of seasons, until he joined Newcastle United on transfer deadline day in the summer of 2011. Signed mainly as a back-up to [[Tim Krul]], he featured for the club sporadically, but became first choice in the [[2015–16 Premier League|2015–16 season]] after Krul suffered a season-ending injury.
Through the origins of his father's family, Elliot became eligible to represent the Republic of Ireland national football team, and was first called up in 2013, making his debut the following year.
==Career== ===Charlton Athletic=== Born in [[Greenwich]], London,<ref>{{Hugman|5864|accessdate=27 August 2017}}</ref> Elliot began his career with [[Non-league football|non-League]] side [[Erith Town F.C.|Erith Town]] before moving to [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]], the team he had supported as a child, when he was 17. After becoming a professional player with the Addicks in 2004, he was sent out on loan twice during the [[2004–05 in English football|2004–05]] season; first to [[Bishop's Stortford F.C.|Bishop's Stortford]] and then [[Notts County F.C.|Notts County]], where he made his [[Football League]] debut.{{cn|date=August 2017}}
The [[2005–06 in English football|following season]], Elliot spent most of the season on loan at the [[Conference National]] club [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]], replacing fellow Charlton goalkeeper [[Darren Randolph]] who had been on loan at Stanley earlier in the year. He was part of the Accrington Stanley team which won promotion to the Football League as runaway champions, saving a vital [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] in the match which guaranteed them promotion. He joined Stanley again on loan during the [[2006–07 in English football|2006–07]] season, but failed to displace [[Ian Dunbavin]] as the club's first choice goalkeeper. He was voted the best keeper of the past decade for Accrington Stanley in 2010 by numerous key figures for the club, including manager [[John Coleman (footballer, born 1962)|John Coleman]].
Back at Charlton, Elliot was considered to be behind [[Nicky Weaver]] and Darren Randolph for most of the [[2007–08 in English football|2007–08]] season. After Randolph moved to [[Bury F.C.|Bury]] on loan Elliot was promoted to second choice. He made an unexpected debut for Charlton on 5 April 2008 after Weaver had been sent off in a match against [[Plymouth Argyle F.C.|Plymouth Argyle]]. He made his first start for Charlton in a [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] defeat to [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] in August 2008. During the [[2008–09 in English football|2008–09]] season, he displaced Weaver and established himself as the club's first choice goalkeeper. A string of impressive performances contributing to a record breaking start to a season for Charlton in 2009–10 led to him signing a contract extension committing him to the club until 2012. In August 2011, Newcastle United made an offer of £100,000 which was rejected by Charlton.
===Newcastle United=== On 30 August 2011, Elliot signed for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] on a five-year contract, becoming their seventh summer signing. He then stated his desire to become first choice 'keeper.<ref>{{cite web |title=Keeper Elliot joins Newcastle |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12875_7139466,00.html |work=Sky Sports|publisher=BSkyB |date=30 August 2011 |accessdate=30 August 2011}}</ref> He made his Newcastle debut on 20 September against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] in the [[2011–12 Football League Cup|Football League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Nott'm Forest 3–4 Newcastle (aet)|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14893631.stm |publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 September 2011|accessdate=20 September 2011}}</ref>
At the start of the [[2012–13 Premier League|2012–13 season]], Elliot changed his squad number from 35 to 21, which was previously worn by [[Fraser Forster]]. He made his second Newcastle appearance in the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] on 20 September against [[C.S. Marítimo|Marítimo]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Maritimo 0–0 Newcastle |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19582553|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 September 2012|accessdate=20 September 2012}}</ref> His third Newcastle appearance, and second of the season, came in a third round [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]] tie away at [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19645229|title=Man Utd 2–1 Newcastle|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 September 2012}}</ref> On 24 February 2013, and following an injury to [[Tim Krul]], Elliot made his first Premier League appearance for the Magpies, starting against Southampton in a 4–2 victory. During the match, after conceding a goal in the third minute, he then assisted a [[Papiss Cissé]] wonder goal in the first half.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/21489679|title=Newcastle 4–2 Southampton|publisher=24 February 2013|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref> On 12 May, Elliot was sent off against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], following a second yellow card.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/22417786|title=QPR 2–1 Newcastle|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 May 2013|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref>
Elliot started the [[2015–16 Premier League|2015–16 season]] as third choice 'keeper behind Krul and [[Karl Darlow]]. However, with Krul suffering a season-ending injury and Darlow still recovering from an ankle knock, Elliot was handed his first appearance of the season on 18 October at home to [[Norwich City F.C|Norwich City]], helping Newcastle to a 6–2 win, their first win of the campaign.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34498802|title=Newcastle United 6–2 Norwich City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=18 October 2015|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref> Before the game, it was revealed that Elliot had signed a 'new, long-term contract' back in January 2014. Elliot continued his run in the team, keeping successive clean sheets against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34623900|title=Newcastle United 0–0 Stoke City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 October 2015|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref> and [[Bournemouth A.F.C.|Bournemouth]], the latter performance earning him the man-of-the-match award in a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/34686457|title=Bournemouth 0–1 Newcastle|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 November 2015|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref> This was the first time Newcastle had kept two clean sheets in a row in two years and their first away win in ten months.
On 29 March 2016, whilst on international duty, Elliot sustained an anterior cruciate ligament injury, and was ruled out of action for six months, ending his hopes of a place on the Republic of Ireland squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/mar/30/newcastle-rob-elliot-euro-2016-republic-of-ireland|title=Newcastle's Rob Elliot in tears after knee injury rules out Euro 2016|work=The Guardian|first=David|last=Hynter|date=30 March 2016}}</ref>
Elliot returned to the Newcastle squad in December, but by then, Darlow had usurped him as the first choice 'keeper. For the next two months, he was not involved in the first team, but did make two appearances for the [[Newcastle United F.C. Reserves and Academy|reserves]]. From February 2017 onwards, Elliot would be on the bench until 24 April, when Darlow himself was benched due to squad rotation.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/rob-elliot-emotional-injury-return-12942968|title=Rob Elliot on his emotional injury return, Benitez, and why Newcastle is not a 'stepping stone'|work=Evening Chronicle|first=Chris|last=Waugh|date=26 April 2017|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref> Elliot's first appearance of the season came in a 4–1 win over [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39618289|title=Newcastle United 4–1 Preston North End|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 April 2017|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref> On 28 April, he was named captain against [[Cardiff City F.C.|Cardiff City]], keeping a clean sheet as Newcastle won 2–0.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39663244|title=Cardiff City 0–2 Newcastle United|publisher=BBC Sport|date=28 April 2017|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref> On 7 May, he again kept a clean sheet, as Newcastle beat [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] 3–0, edging out [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] by a point to win the [[2016–17 EFL Championship|Championship]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39760419|title=Newcastle United 3–0 Barnsley|publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 May 2017|accessdate=11 August 2017}}</ref>
On 11 August 2017, Elliot's shirt number was changed from 21 to 1 in the 2017–18 squad number announcement, replacing [[Tim Krul]], who had been linked with a permanent move to Brighton & Hove Albion.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nufc.co.uk/news/latest-news/201718-squad-numbers-confirmed|title=2017/18 squad numbers confirmed|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|first=Tom|last=Easterby|date=11 August 2017}}</ref>
Elliot has yet to make an appearance for Newcastle in the 2018-19 season, having lost his place in the side to [[Martin Dubravka]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/derby-county-target-could-leave-2424377|title=Derby County ‘target’ could leave this month – Premier League boss has admitted|date=13 January 2019|publisher=Derby Telegraph|accessdate=15 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Elliot, who was born in England, is eligible for the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] through his father's family from [[Cork (city)|Cork]], and represented Ireland at [[Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team|under-19]] level.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nufcblog.com/2013/09/11/newcastle-player-has-international-ambitions/|title=Newcastle Player Has International Ambitions|publisher=NUFC Blog|author=Ed Harrison|date=11 September 2013}}</ref> On 5 October 2013, Elliot received his first call-up to the Republic of Ireland senior squad as a replacement for the injured [[Darren Randolph]] for the games against [[Germany national football team|Germany]] and [[Kazakhstan national football team|Kazakhstan]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Newcastle Goalkeeper Elliot gets first Ireland call|url=http://www.irishtimes.com/sport/soccer/international/newcastle-goalkeeper-elliot-gets-first-ireland-call-1.1551816 |work=The Irish Times|date=5 October 2013}}</ref> Elliot won his first international senior cap for the Republic of Ireland on 25 May 2014, in a 2–1 home loss to [[Turkey national football team|Turkey]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fai.ie/international/senior-men/103994-narrow-defeat-for-ireland-against-turkey.html|title=Republic of Ireland 1–2 Turkey|publisher=FAI.com|date=25 May 2014}}</ref>

{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Paul Dummett | image = AUT vs. WAL 2016-10-06 (183).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Dummett on international duty with [[Wales national football team|Wales]], 2016 | fullname = Paul Dummett<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=15 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=y|1991|9|26}} | birth_place = [[Newcastle upon Tyne]], England | height = {{convert|1.83|m|ftin|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Teams/PlayerProfile/0,,10278~58196,00.html |title= Newcastle United – Paul Dummett |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 2013 |publisher= Newcastle United |accessdate= 9 January 2015}}</ref> | position = [[Left back]] | currentclub = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | clubnumber = 3 | youthyears1 = 2000–2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Newcastle United F.C. Reserves and Academy|Newcastle United]] | years1 = 2012– | clubs1 = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | caps1 = 150 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2012 | clubs2 = → [[Gateshead F.C.|Gateshead]] (loan) | caps2 = 10 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2012–2013 | clubs3 = → [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]] (loan) | caps3 = 16 | goals3 = 2 | years4 = 2013 | clubs4 = → [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]] (loan) | caps4 = 14 | goals4 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam1 = [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014– | nationalteam2 = [[Wales national football team|Wales]] | nationalcaps2 = 5 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 17:19, 16 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 20 March 2019 }} '''Paul Dummett''' (born 26 September 1991) is a professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[left back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] and the [[Wales national football team|Wales national team]].
Dummett began his career with his local side Newcastle United. After progressing through the youth ranks at the club, he had loan spells at [[Gateshead F.C.|Gateshead]] and Scottish side [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]]. He made his Premier League debut in the [[2013–14 Newcastle United F.C. season|2013–14 season]] and scored his first Premier League goal against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] on 19 October 2013. Dummett is a first team regular for Newcastle United and was part of their promotion from the Championship.
==Club career==
===Newcastle United=== Dummett started his career in the [[Newcastle United F.C. Reserves and Academy|Newcastle United]] youth system,<ref>{{cite news|title=Debutant Paul Dummett is desperate to be talk of the Toon|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/debutant-paul-dummett-desperate-talk-1350696|publisher=Chronicle Live|date=7 January 2013|accessdate=15 March 2013}}</ref> captaining the club's reserve team on several occasions.
====Loan to Gateshead==== Dummett joined [[Conference National]] side [[Gateshead F.C.|Gateshead]] in March 2012, initially for a month-long loan,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gateshead-fc.com/3906/gateshead-sign-dummett-on-loan |title=Gateshead sign Dummett on loan |publisher=Gateshead FC |date=5 March 2012 |accessdate=30 December 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120925084054/http://www.gateshead-fc.com/3906/gateshead-sign-dummett-on-loan |archivedate=25 September 2012 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> which was then extended until the end of the season,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gateshead-fc.com/3960/dummett-deal-extended |title=Dummett Deal Extended |publisher=Gateshead FC |date=4 April 2012 |accessdate=30 December 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131023062914/http://www.gateshead-fc.com/3960/dummett-deal-extended |archivedate=23 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> helping the team keep six clean sheets from ten matches.<ref>{{Soccerbase season|62466|2011|name=Paul Dummett|access-date=30 December 2012}}</ref>
====Loans to St Mirren==== The following season he was loaned to [[Scottish Premier League]] club [[St Mirren F.C.|St Mirren]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20120831/dummett-is-buddies-bound_2281670_2905979 |title=Dummett Is Buddies-Bound |work=www.nufc.co.uk |publisher=Newcastle United FC |first=Dan |last=King |date=31 August 2012 |accessdate=5 January 2013}}</ref><ref name = "st mirren"/> Dummett made his debut in a 2–0 win over [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]] on 15 September 2012, and scored his first senior goal in a 1–1 draw against [[St Johnstone F.C.|St Johnstone]].<ref>{{cite news|title=St Mirren 1 St Johnstone 1: Buddies salvage point against nine-man Saints |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/st-mirren-1-st-johnstone-1480664|publisher=Daily Record|date=9 December 2012|accessdate=10 January 2013}}</ref>
After returning from his loan spell at St Mirren,<ref>{{cite news|title=Paul Dummett to return to Newcastle following St Mirren loan|url=http://sport.stv.tv/football/clubs/st-mirren/208446-paul-dummett-to-return-to-newcastle-following-st-mirren-loan/|publisher=STV|date=4 January 2013|accessdate=10 January 2013}}</ref> Dummett made his debut senior appearance for Newcastle in an [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]] tie away defeat to [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] on 5 January 2013. After the match, Dummett spoke out on his debut, that his Newcastle United debut was a dream come true.<ref>{{cite news|title=Paul Dummett thrilled with Newcastle debut|url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/paul-dummett-thrilled-newcastle-debut-3735381|publisher=Tribal Football|date=8 January 2013|accessdate=10 January 2013}}</ref> He then rejoined St Mirren on 31 January 2013 on loan for the rest of the season.<ref>{{cite news|title=St Mirren: Paul Dummett returns for new loan spell|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21213700|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 January 2013|accessdate=31 January 2013}}</ref> Dummett played the full game for St Mirren in their [[Scottish League Cup]] Final 3–2 win over Hearts, the club's first major cup for 26 years.<ref>{{cite news|title=St Mirren 3 Hearts 2: Buddies bounce back from a goal behind to win the League Cup Final|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-match-reports/st-mirren-3-hearts-2-1770688|publisher=Daily Record|date=17 March 2013|accessdate=12 June 2013}}</ref> Dummett also set up the second St Mirren goal in the 46th minute, for [[Steven Thompson (Scottish footballer)|Steven Thompson]], which put the Saints 2–1 up.
====Return to Newcastle United==== [[File:Paul Dummett 2016.jpg|thumb|upright|Dummett playing for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in 2016]]
Dummett returned to Newcastle, and signed a one-year contract extension.<ref>{{cite news|title=Conor Newton and Paul Dummett have agreed new deals at Newcastle|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11678/8792260/Conor-Newton-and-Paul-Dummett-have-agreed-new-deals-at-Newcastle|publisher=Sky Sports|date=25 June 2012|accessdate=27 July 2013}}</ref> He made his debut for the club as a substitute during a 4–0 defeat to [[Manchester City]] on the opening fixture of the 2013–14 season, coming on after a sending off of fellow defender [[Steven Taylor (footballer)|Steven Taylor]] and playing the full second half of the game.<ref>{{cite news|title=Manchester City 4–0 Newcastle United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23662898|accessdate=23 May 2014|newspaper=[[BBC Sport]]|date=23 May 2014}}</ref> He scored his first goal for Newcastle in a 2–2 draw at home to [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in October 2013.<ref>{{cite news|title=First Goal For Dummett As 10-Man Newcastle Make Point|url=http://tyneandwear.sky.com/newcastleunited/article/86080/newcastle-united-2-2-liverpool-first-goal-for-dummett-as-10|publisher=Sky Tyne & Wear|date=19 October 2013|accessdate=23 October 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131029210607/http://tyneandwear.sky.com/newcastleunited/article/86080/newcastle-united-2-2-liverpool-first-goal-for-dummett-as-10|archivedate=29 October 2013|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Just weeks after scoring his goal for the club, Dummett put pen-to-paper on a new contract at Newcastle, signing a deal that could extend until 2019.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24504079|title=Newcastle United 2–2 Liverpool|first=|last=Mandeep Sanghera BBC Sport|publisher=}}</ref>
On the final day of the season, Dummett made a challenge on Liverpool forward [[Luis Suárez]]. Due to knee surgery which jeopardised Suárez's chances of playing at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]], fans in his native Uruguay sent online death threats to Dummett.<ref>{{cite news|title=Luis Suarez injury: Uruguay fans blame Newcastle's Paul Dummett|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27534751|accessdate=23 May 2014|newspaper=[[BBC Sport]]|date=23 May 2014}}</ref>
Dummett started the [[2014–15 Newcastle United F.C. season|2014–15 season]] as Newcastle's first-choice left back, with [[Davide Santon]] injured and [[Massadio Haïdara]] on the bench. Dummett grabbed his second Magpies goal on 25 September 2014, scoring a late winner in extra-time against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Crystal Palace 2–3 Newcastle United (aet)|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29233096|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 September 2014|accessdate=26 September 2014}}</ref> Playing alongside captain [[Fabricio Coloccini]] in the centre of defence, Dummett helped Newcastle keep clean sheets in victories over [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] and [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Manchester City vs. Newcastle United – 29 October 2014|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/10/29/england/league-cup/manchester-city-football-club/newcastle-united-football-club/1950095/|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=10 November 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=West Bromwich Albion vs. Newcastle United – 9 November 2014|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/11/09/england/premier-league/west-bromwich-albion-football-club/newcastle-united-football-club/1703711/|publisher=Soccerway|accessdate=10 November 2014}}</ref> On 12 January 2016, Dummett scored a 90th minute equaliser against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] in a match that ended in a 3–3 draw at [[St James' Park]].
==International career== Dummett qualifies to play for [[Wales national football team|Wales]] through his Welsh grandfather.<ref>{{cite web|title=Paul Dummett profile|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Teams/PlayerProfile/0,,10278~58196,00.html|publisher=nufc.co.uk|accessdate=18 May 2014}}</ref> He was capped at [[Wales national under-21 football team|under-21]] level for Wales.<ref name="st mirren">{{cite web |url=http://www.saintmirren.net/pages/?p=15248 |title=Defender in on Loan |date=31 August 2012 |accessdate=5 January 2013 |work=www.saintmirren.net |publisher=St Mirren FC |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131023063134/http://www.saintmirren.net/pages/?p=15248 |archivedate=23 October 2013 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He made his senior debut for Wales in the match against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] on 4 June 2014, coming in as a substitute in the 83rd minute. Dummett played his second international match on 13 November 2015, again against the Netherlands, coming on for [[Neil Taylor (footballer)|Neil Taylor]] in 65th minute. In May 2016, Dummett was listed for the 29-man squad for a pre-[[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]] training camp.<ref>{{cite news|title=Gareth Bale left out of Wales' Euro 2016 training squad because of Champions League commitments|url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/gareth-bale-left-out-wales-11307513|publisher=Wales Online|date=9 May 2016|accessdate=11 November 2016}}</ref> However, Dummett was among six players to be cut for the Euro 2016 squad.<ref>{{cite news|title=Euro 2016: Huddersfield Town transfer target makes Wales squad but Emyr Huws cut|url=http://www.examiner.co.uk/sport/football/news/euro-2016-huddersfield-town-transfer-11408209|publisher=The Huddersfield Examiner|date=31 May 2016|accessdate=11 November 2016}}</ref> In May 2017, Wales manager [[Chris Coleman (footballer)|Chris Coleman]] said that Dummett would no longer make himself available for international selection.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40049274 |title=Paul Dummett: Newcastle United defender quits Wales duty |first=Owain |last=Llyr |work=BBC Sport |publisher=BBC |date=26 May 2017 |accessdate=26 May 2017}}</ref> He was recalled to the national team in August 2018.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45342667|title=Hal Robson-Kanu: Wales forward retires from international football|date=29 August 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|via=www.bbc.co.uk|accessdate=29 August 2018}}</ref>

'''Fabian Lukas Schär''' (born 20 December 1991) is a Swiss [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Centre back|centre back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United]].
Formed at [[FC Wil 1900|Wil]], he transferred to [[FC Basel|Basel]] in 2012, winning the [[Swiss Super League]] in all three of his seasons before his move to [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]].
After playing at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Olympics]], he made his senior debut for Switzerland in 2013. Schär represented the nation at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016]].
==Club career== ===Wil=== Born in [[Wil]], [[Canton of St. Gallen]], Schär began his playing career at hometown club [[FC Wil 1900|Wil]] and rose through the youth ranks, soon playing regularly for Wil's reserve team. He eventually made his league debut on 29 November 2009 against [[FC Stade Nyonnais]], coming on as a late substitute. He scored his first [[Swiss Challenge League]] goal in an away win against [[Yverdon-Sport FC|Yverdon-Sport]] on 30 October 2010.
===Basel=== On 4 July 2012, Schär transferred to [[FC Basel|Basel]] on a three-year contract with the option of a fourth.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.football.ch/de/desktopdefault.aspx/tabid-53/1423_read-7160/ |title=Olympia-Teilnehmer Schär zum FCB |work=Schweizerischer Fussballverband |date=4 July 2012 |accessdate=4 July 2012 |language=German |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150721031035/http://www.football.ch/de/desktopdefault.aspx/tabid-53/1423_read-7160/ |archive-date=21 July 2015 |dead-url=no |df=dmy-all }}</ref><ref name="fcb1">{{cite web | date = 4 July 2012 | url = http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/28160/26/7/7 | title = Der FCB verpflichtet Innenverteidiger Fabian Schär vom FC Wil 1900 | publisher = FC Basel 1893 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | language = German | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20131019124839/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/28160/26/7/7 | archive-date = 19 October 2013 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }}</ref> He made his [[Swiss Super League]] debut on 29 September in a 1–1 away draw against [[FC Lausanne-Sport|Lausanne-Sport]].<ref name="fcb2">{{cite web | last = Weber | first = Dominik | date = 29 September 2012 | url = http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/28726/26/7/7 | title = FCB kommt bei Lausanne-Sport nicht über ein 1:1-Remis hinaus | publisher = FC Basel 1893 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | language = German | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20131019124836/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/28726/26/7/7 | archive-date = 19 October 2013 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }}</ref> He scored his first goal for his new club on 7 October in the [[St. Jakob-Park]] during the 3–2 home win against [[Servette FC|Servette]], heading an equaliser following a corner from [[Fabian Frei]].<ref name="fcb3">{{cite web | last = Meister | first = Remo | url = http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/28781/26/7/7 | title = Der FCB holt gegen Servette den fünften Liga-Sieg, Tor-Premiere für Schär | publisher = FC Basel 1893 | date = 7 October 2012 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | language = German | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20131019124846/http://www.fcb.ch/news/show/byItemID/de-de/10044/28781/26/7/7 | archive-date = 19 October 2013 | dead-url = yes | df = dmy-all }}</ref>
At the end of the [[2012–13 Swiss Super League|Swiss Super League season 2012–13]] Schär won the Championship title<ref name="eufa 2013-06-10">{{cite web | last = Schifferle | first = Michael | url = http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=sui/news/newsid=1959420.html | title = Season review: Switzerland | publisher = UEFA | date = 10 June 2013 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20130613165758/http://www.uefa.com/memberassociations/association=sui/news/newsid=1959420.html | archive-date = 13 June 2013 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }}</ref> and was [[2012–13 Swiss Cup|Swiss Cup runner up]] with Basel.<ref name="sfv2013-05-20">{{cite web | url = http://www.football.ch/de/SFV/Schweizer-Cup/Schweizer-Cup-Maenner/Statistik-und-Resultate-Schweizer-Cup/Telegramm-Schweizer-Cup.aspx/tg-2132469/ | title = Telegramm Schweizer Cup Fina | publisher = Schweizerischer Fussballverband | date = 20 May 2013 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | language = German}}</ref> In the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League]] Basel advanced as far as the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League knockout phase#Semi-finals|semi-finals]], there being matched against the reigning [[UEFA Champions League]] holders [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], but they were knocked out losing both matches and being beaten 2–5 on aggregate.<ref name="eufa 2013-05-03">{{cite web | last = Haylett | first = Trevor | url = http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1945605.html | title = Basel take heart after Chelsea defeat | publisher = UEFA | date = 3 May 2013 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20130504131827/http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/news/newsid=1945605.html | archive-date = 4 May 2013 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }}</ref>
At the end of the [[2013–14 Swiss Super League|2013–14 Super League season]] Schär won his second league championship with Basel.<ref name="fcb 2014-05-18">{{cite web | last = Grossenbacher | first = Sacha | authorlink = | coauthors = | year = 2014 | url = http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/Saison/Saisonspiel?m=2816 | title = Fotos vom Spiel gegen Lausanne sowie den anschliessenden Feierlichkeiten | format = | work = | publisher = FC Basel 1893 | accessdate = 18 May 2014 | language = de | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20141016072845/http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/Saison/Saisonspiel?m=2816 | archive-date = 16 October 2014 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }}</ref> They also reached the final of the [[2013–14 Swiss Cup]], but were beaten 2–0 by [[FC Zürich|Zürich]] after extra time. During the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|2013–14 Champions League season]] Basel reached the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] and finished the group in third position. Thus they qualified for [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League knockout phase|Europa League knockout phase]] and here they advanced as far as the quarter-finals.
The 2014–15 season was a very successful one for Basel and Schär. Basel won the championship for the sixth time in a row [[2014–15 Swiss Super League|that season]].<ref name="fcb 2015-05-29">{{cite web | last = Marti | first = Caspar | authorlink = | coauthors = | year = 2015 | url = http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/News/2015/05/29/Der-Meisterfreitag-im-bunten-Zeitraffer | title = Der Meisterfreitag im bunten Zeitraffer | format = | work = | publisher = FC Basel 1893 | accessdate = 29 May 2015 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20151222103948/http://www.fcb.ch/de-CH/News/2015/05/29/Der-Meisterfreitag-im-bunten-Zeitraffer | archive-date = 22 December 2015 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }} {{de icon}}</ref> In the [[2014–15 Swiss Cup]] they reached the final, but for the third season in a row, they finished as runners-up, losing 0–3 to [[FC Sion|Sion]] in the final. Basel entered the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League group stage|group stage]] and reached the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League knockout phase|knockout stages]], with a 1–1 away draw against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] enough to take them through.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29363537|title=Liverpool 1 Basel 1|date=10 December 2014|work=BBC Sport|accessdate=10 December 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141210055816/http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/29363537|archive-date=10 December 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Basel later lost to Porto in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League#Round of 16|Round of 16]].
===Hoffenheim=== On 4 June 2015, Schär signed for [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|Hoffenheim]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Fabian Schär kommt vom FC Basel zur TSG|url=http://www.achtzehn99.de/fabian-schaer-kommt-vom-fc-basel-zur-tsg/|publisher=TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|accessdate=4 June 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150607015832/http://www.achtzehn99.de/fabian-schaer-kommt-vom-fc-basel-zur-tsg/|archive-date=7 June 2015|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Deportivo La Coruña=== On 21 July 2017, Schär signed a four-year deal with [[Deportivo de La Coruña]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rcdeportivo.es/en/new/new-player-fabian-schar|title=New Player! Fabian Schär|publisher=Deportivo La Coruña|date=21 July 2017|accessdate=26 August 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170827045927/http://www.rcdeportivo.es/en/new/new-player-fabian-schar|archive-date=27 August 2017|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his [[La Liga]] debut on 20 August, starting in a 3–0 home loss against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2017_18/la-liga/jornada_1/dep_rma/|title=Imponente campeón|trans-title=Imposing champion|publisher=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|language=es|date=21 August 2017|accessdate=26 August 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170825160113/http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2017_18/la-liga/jornada_1/dep_rma/|archive-date=25 August 2017|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He scored two goals in the [[2017–18 La Liga|2017–18 season]], which ended in relegation for the [[Galicia (Spain)|Galician]] team.
===Newcastle United===
On 26 July 2018, following Deportivo de La Coruña's relegation from the La Liga, Schär signed a three-year deal with [[Newcastle United]] after the club had activated his £3 million buy out clause in his contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/soccer-transfers/story/3575550/newcastle-sign-switzerland-defender-fabian-schar-from-deportivo-la-coruna|publisher=ESPN|title=Newcastle sign Switzerland defender Fabian Schar from Deportivo La Coruna|date=26 July 2018|accessdate=4 March 2019}}</ref>
He made his debut for the club on the 26th of August 2018 in a 2–1 defeat to Chelsea. Schär scored his first goals for Newcastle against Cardiff City on the 19th of January 2019, netting twice in a 3–0 victory at St James’ Park.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/46847680|publisher=BBC|title=Newcastle lifted themselves out of the relegation zone and leapfrogged Cardiff as they secured a much-needed win over Neil Warnock's side.|date=19 January 2019|accessdate=4 March 2019}}</ref> He scored his third Newcastle goal against Burnley in a 2-0 win, opening the scoring with a 30 yard strike that would win Match of the Day’s February Goal of the Month competition. <ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2019/02/26/newcastle-united-vs-burnley-premier-league-live-score-updates/|publisher=The Telegraph|title=Fabian Schar screamer eases Newcastle to serene victory over pedestrian Burnley|date=26 February 2019|accessdate=4 March 2019}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:AUT vs. SUI 2015-11-17 (252).jpg|175px|thumb|Schär with Switzerland in 2015]]
Schär was a Switzerland youth international having played at under-20 and under-21 level. Schär made his international debut for the Swiss U-20 team in a game against [[Poland national under-20 football team|Poland U-20]] on 17 November 2011. He played his first game for the [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Swiss U-21]] on 29 February 2012 in the 1–2 defeat against the [[Austria national under-21 football team|Austrian U-21]]. He scored his first goal for the Swiss U-21 during his fourth appearance for them on 10 September 2012 in a match against [[Estonia national under-21 football team|Estonia U-21]]<ref name="eufa1">{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2013/matches/round=2000192/match=2006876/index.html | title = Switzerland triumph over Estonia | publisher = uefa.com | date = 10 September 2012 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20131019184545/http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2013/matches/round=2000192/match=2006876/index.html | archive-date = 19 October 2013 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }}</ref> This was the final game in the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship qualification Group 5|qualification to the 2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship]]. Switzerland finished in second position and entered the play-offs. In the first leg of the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Football Championship qualification play-offs|qualification play-offs]] on 12 October 2012 against [[Germany national under-21 football team|the German U-21 team]] Schär was shown the red card after he fouled [[Sebastian Polter]] as last man. Despite the goal from the penalty spot the game ended in a 1–1 draw.<ref name="eufa2">{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2013/matches/round=2000193/match=2010664/index.html | title = Drmic intervention saves ten-man Switzerland | publisher = uefa.com | date = 12 October 2012 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20131224163846/http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2013/matches/round=2000193/match=2010664/index.html | archive-date = 24 December 2013 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }}</ref>
He was selected to represent Switzerland in the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|men's football tournament at the 2012 Summer Olympics]] as part of the [[Switzerland national under-23 football team|Swiss under-23 team]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football.ch/de/desktopdefault.aspx/tabid-64/2102_read-6697/ |title=Schweiz mit Behrami, Benaglio und Klose an die Olympischen Spiele |work=Schweizerischer Fussballverband |date=4 July 2012 |language=German |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160129234336/http://www.football.ch/de/desktopdefault.aspx/tabid-64/2102_read-6697/ |archivedate=29 January 2016 }}</ref> He played over 90 minutes in the first two games of the tournament, but the team were knocked out, finishing in fourth position of their [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament – Group B|Group]].
On 6 September 2013, Schär scored his first goal for the [[Switzerland national football team|Swiss senior team]] in a 4–4 home draw against [[Iceland national football team|Iceland]]. Four days later, on 10 September, Schär scored two more goals in a 2–0 away win over [[Norway national football team|Norway]].<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008653/postmatch/report/index.html | title = Schär leaves Switzerland with one foot in Brazil | publisher = UEFA | date = 10 September 2013 | accessdate = 6 November 2013 | first = Eivind | last = Aarre | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20131019054212/http://www.uefa.com/worldcup/season=2014/matches/round=2000294/match=2008653/postmatch/report/index.html | archive-date = 19 October 2013 | dead-url = no | df = dmy-all }}</ref>
On 13 May 2014, Schär was named in Switzerland's squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27391728|title=World Cup 2014: Pajtim Kasami on standby for Switzerland|date=13 May 2014|accessdate=13 May 2014|work=BBC|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140513235232/http://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/27391728|archive-date=13 May 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his tournament debut as a starter in the team's third match, replacing the injured [[Steve von Bergen]] and helping Switzerland to a clean sheet in a 3–0 defeat of [[Honduras national football team|Honduras]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/switzerland|title=Switzerland 3–0 Honduras|date=26 June 2014|accessdate=27 June 2014|work=BBC|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140626023236/http://www.bbc.com/sport/football/teams/switzerland|archive-date=26 June 2014|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In Switzerland's first game of [[UEFA Euro 2016]], Schär headed [[Xherdan Shaqiri]]'s corner kick after five minutes for the only goal against [[Albania national football team|Albania]] in [[Lens, Pas-de-Calais|Lens]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Tweedale|last2=Liew|first1=Alistair|first2=Jonathan (11 June 2016)|title=Switzerland down 10-man Albania as Xhaka derby is settled by Fabian Schar header|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/06/10/albania-vs-switzerland-euro-2016-live/|website=Telegraph|accessdate=11 June 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160610210216/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2016/06/10/albania-vs-switzerland-euro-2016-live/|archive-date=10 June 2016|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He was included in the [[Switzerland national football team]] 23 man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>https://www.washingtonpost.com/amphtml/sports/dcunited/switzerland-opts-for-experience-in-world-cup-squad/2018/06/04/86572ee2-680a-11e8-a335-c4503d041eaf_story.html</ref>

9 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Jamaal Lascelles''' ({{IPAc-en|dʒ|ə|ˈ|m|ɑː|l|_|l|ə|ˈ|s|ɛ|l|s}}; born 11 November 1993) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for {{English football updater|NewcastU}} club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].
==Club career== ===Nottingham Forest=== Lascelles was born in [[Derby]], Derbyshire.<ref name=Hugman/> He began his career at [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]], progressing through the club's youth system.<ref>{{cite news| title = Arsenal and Spurs target Lascelles heads to Stevenage to gain experience| url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2112883/Arsenal-Tottenham-target-Jamaal-Lascelles-joins-Stevenage-loan.html|newspaper=Daily Mail|location=London| date = 9 March 2012| accessdate = 14 March 2012}}</ref> In January 2011, the club rejected a £5 million offer from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] for him.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thisisnottingham.co.uk/Nottingham-Forest-rejected-163-5m-bid-rookie-defender-Lascelles-January/story-12246464-detail/story.html|title=Nottingham Forest rejected a £5m bid for rookie defender Lascelles in January|date=21 April 2011|newspaper=Nottingham Evening Post|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120210103648/http://www.thisisnottingham.co.uk/Nottingham-Forest-rejected-163-5m-bid-rookie-defender-Lascelles-January/story-12246464-detail/story.html|archivedate=10 February 2012|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news| title = Spurs join Arsenal in race for highly-rated Forest hot shot Lascelles| url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2097423/Tottenham-Arsenal-want-Jamaal-Lascelles.html#| newspaper = Daily Mail|location=London| date = 6 February 2012| accessdate = 21 April 2012}}</ref> He signed his first professional contract in March 2011.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thisisnottingham.co.uk/Forest-tie-rising-star/story-12265721-detail/story.html|title=Forest tie up rising young defender Jamaal Lascelles|date=30 March 2011|newspaper=Nottingham Evening Post|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110829224701/http://www.thisisnottingham.co.uk/Forest-tie-rising-star/story-12265721-detail/story.html|archivedate=29 August 2011|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Lascelles made his first-team debut on 31 January 2012, starting in a 2–0 defeat to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].<ref name="Nott'm Forest 0–2 Burnley">{{cite news| title = Nott'm Forest 0–2 Burnley| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16695938 |publisher=BBC Sport| date = 31 January 2012| accessdate = 9 March 2012}}</ref>
====Loan to Stevenage==== In March 2012, Lascelles joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Stevenage F.C.|Stevenage]], on loan until the end of the [[2011–12 in English football|2011–12]] season.<ref name="Boro secure Lascelles loan deal">{{cite news| title = Boro secure Lascelles loan deal| url = http://www.stevenagefc.com/page/LatestNewsDetail/0,,10839~2642621,00.html| publisher = Stevenage F.C.| date = 9 March 2012| accessdate = 9 March 2012| archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20120312052242/http://www.stevenagefc.com/page/LatestNewsDetail/0%2C%2C10839~2642621%2C00.html| archive-date = 12 March 2012| dead-url = yes| df = dmy-all}}</ref><ref name="Loan Ranger Lascelles">{{cite news| title = Loan Ranger Lascelles| url = http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/loan-ranger-lascelles-64883.aspx| publisher = Nottingham Forest F.C.| date = 9 March 2012| accessdate = 9 August 2012| deadurl = yes| archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20140808051412/http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/loan-ranger-lascelles-64883.aspx| archivedate = 8 August 2014| df = dmy-all}}</ref> He made his debut for Stevenage on 13 March 2012, coming on as a 69th-minute substitute in a 1–0 home win over [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]], playing in the right-back position.<ref>{{cite news|title=Stevenage 1–0 Oldham|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17268003|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 March 2012|accessdate=14 March 2012}}</ref> He made his first starting appearance in Stevenage's 6–0 away victory at [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] on 14 April 2012, scoring the club's fourth goal with a header from [[Luke Freeman]]'s cross.<ref name="Yeovil 0–6 Stevenage">{{cite news| title = Yeovil 0–6 Stevenage| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17643247| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 14 April 2012| accessdate = 14 April 2012}}</ref> Lascelles also provided the assist for [[Patrick Agyemang]]'s goal in the same game.<ref name="Yeovil Town 0–6 Stevenage FC">{{cite news|title=Yeovil Town 0–6 Stevenage FC |url=http://www.stevenagefc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10839~58970,00.html |publisher=Stevenage F.C. |date=14 April 2012 |accessdate=14 April 2012 }}{{dead link|date=April 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> He remained as a first-team regular from then onwards, playing the remaining four games of the regular season as Stevenage secured a League One play-off spot.<ref name="Stevenage 3–0 Bury">{{cite news| title = Stevenage 3–0 Bury| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17878455| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 5 May 2012| accessdate = 16 May 2012}}</ref> Lascelles also played in both play-off matches, as Stevenage lost 1–0 on aggregate to [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].<ref name="Stevenage 0–0 Sheffield United">{{cite news| title = Stevenage 0–0 Sheffield United| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17971363| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 11 May 2012| accessdate = 16 May 2012}}</ref><ref name="Sheffield United 1–0 Stevenage">{{cite news| title = Sheffield United 1–0 Stevenage| url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17980126| publisher = BBC Sport| date = 14 May 2012| accessdate = 16 May 2012}}</ref> He made nine appearances during his two-month loan spell, scoring once.<ref name=sb1112/>
====Return to Nottingham Forest==== On 7 August 2012, Lascelles signed a new four-year contract with Nottingham Forest.<ref>{{cite news|title=Lascelles Pledges Future To Reds|publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C.|url=http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/lascelles-pledges-future-to-reds-297255.aspx|date=7 August 2012|accessdate=9 August 2012|first=Fraser|last=Nicholson}}</ref> He made a total of three appearances in all competitions in the 2012–13 season.<ref name=sb1213/>
Lascelles broke into the starting line-up in the 2013–14 season,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Percy|first1=John|title=Nottingham Forest Jamaal Lascelles handed new deal in a bid to keep him at Nottingham Forest|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/nottingham-forest/10569805/Nottingham-Forest-Jamaal-Lascelles-handed-new-deal-in-a-bid-to-keep-him-at-Nottingham-Forest.html|accessdate=5 August 2014|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|location=London|date=13 January 2014}}</ref> forming a central defensive partnership with [[Jack Hobbs (footballer)|Jack Hobbs]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Nottingham Forest hope to fend of Premier League interest in Jamaal Lascelles with new deal|url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/Nottingham-Forest-hope-fend-Premier-League-Jamaal/story-20438991-detail/story.html|accessdate=4 August 2014|newspaper=Nottingham Post|date=14 January 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140910104134/http://www.nottinghampost.com/Nottingham-Forest-hope-fend-Premier-League-Jamaal/story-20438991-detail/story.html|archive-date=10 September 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and making a total of 29 league appearances.<ref name=sb1314/> On 22 January 2014, [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] were fined £45,000 by the FA over an "unauthorised approach" to Lascelles in 2010 while he was still a youth player at Nottingham Forest. Lascelles was warned as to his future conduct.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25843264 |title=Everton fined over approach for Forest's Jamaal Lascelles |date=22 January 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=22 January 2014}}</ref> On 18 March, Lascelles extended his contract in a new four-and-a-half-year deal.<ref>{{cite web|title=Championship: Jamaal Lascelles and Jamie Paterson sign Nottingham Forest deals|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11727/9220801/championship-jamaal-lascelles-and-jamie-paterson-sign-nottingham-forest-deals|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=4 August 2014|date=18 March 2014}}</ref> A reported £4 million bid from [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] was rejected by the club in July.<ref>{{cite web|title=Transfer news: QPR make undisclosed bid for Nottingham Forest defender Jamaal Lascelles|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11727/9369521/transfer-news-qpr-make-undisclosed-bid-for-nottingham-forest-defender-jamaal-lascelles|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=4 August 2014|date=2 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Jamaal Lascelles: Nottingham Forest reject QPR offer|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/28159706|accessdate=4 August 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 July 2014}}</ref>
===Newcastle United=== [[File:Newcastle United vs Sheffield Wednesday, 23 September 2015 (10).JPG|thumb|upright|Lascelles playing for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in 2015]]
On 9 August 2014, Lascelles signed a contract with [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]], joining on the same day as Forest teammate [[Karl Darlow]]. As part of the deal, both players were loaned back to Nottingham Forest for the [[2014-15 in English football|2014–15]] season.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Marshall|first1=Anthony|title=United Complete Lascelles And Darlow Deal|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20140809/united-complete-lascelles-and-darlow-deal_2281670_4055609|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|accessdate=9 August 2014|date=9 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Magpies swoop for Jamaal and Karl|url=http://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/article/magpies-swoop-for-jamaal-and-karl-1802814.aspx|publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C.|accessdate=9 August 2014|date=9 August 2014}}</ref>
Lascelles returned to Newcastle for the [[2015-16 in English football|2015–16]] season and made his debut for the club on 25 August 2015, against [[Northampton Town F.C.|Northampton Town]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Newcastle 4–1 Northampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33970053|accessdate=5 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 August 2015}}</ref> He made his league debut on 3 October, as a substitute in a 6–1 defeat at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Man City 6–1 Newcastle|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34366600|accessdate=5 October 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|date=3 October 2015}}</ref> Lascelles found first-team football hard to come by and did not make his first league start for Newcastle until 23 January 2016, when he played in the 2–1 defeat to Watford, capping his performance with a goal.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35331083|title=Watford 2–1 Newcastle United|date=23 January 2016|accessdate=4 August 2016}}</ref> Lascelles publicly criticised the mentality of his teammates after a 3–1 loss to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 11 April 2016, questioning their character and desire.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36014870|title=Jamaal Lascelles: Newcastle United need to show character and heart to survive|publisher=BBC Sport|date=11 April 2016|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref> Following injuries to first choice centre-backs [[Chancel Mbemba]] and [[Fabricio Coloccini]], Lascelles was given regular minutes under new manager [[Rafael Benítez]] and gradually stepped up his game, grabbing his second goal for the club in the 3–0 win over [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] on 16 April.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36003773|title=Newcastle United 3–0 Swansea City 0|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 April 2016|accessdate=4 August 2016}}</ref> Lascelles totalled 18 appearances in his first Premier League season, but could not prevent the club getting relegated.
On 4 August 2016, Lascelles was chosen by Benítez to become the new Newcastle United team captain,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20160804/lascelles-appointed-united-captain_2281670_5778951|title=Lascelles Appointed United Captain|publisher=Newcastle United F.C.|date=4 August 2016|accessdate=4 August 2016}}</ref> succeeding the departed [[Fabricio Coloccini]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20160804/lascelles-appointed-united-captain_2281670_5778951|title=Newcastle United name Jamaal Lascelles skipper|publisher=Sky Sports News|date=4 August 2016|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref> Benítez had been impressed by Lascelles' willingness to speak up in the dressing room, in particular his criticism of more senior players in the defeat to Southampton.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/09/21/jamaal-lascelles-exclusive-interview-meet-23-year-old-captain|title=Jamaal Lascelles exclusive interview: Meet the 23-year-old captain Rafael Benitez is building his Newcastle United team around|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=21 September 2017|accessdate=6 October 2017 | first=Luke | last=Edwards}}</ref> Despite requiring a double hernia operation, Lascelles played through the pain barrier for the last four months of the [[2016-17 in English football|2016–17]] season,<ref>{{cite news|url=https://en.vavel.com/football/premier-league/newcastle-united/784635-jamaal-lascelles-to-undergo-surgery-after-playing-through-pain-barrier.html|title=Jamaal Lascelles to undergo surgery after playing through pain barrier|newspaper=[[Vavel]]|date=2 May 2016|accessdate=6 October 2017|first=Adam|last=Smith|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171007021427/https://en.vavel.com/football/premier-league/newcastle-united/784635-jamaal-lascelles-to-undergo-surgery-after-playing-through-pain-barrier.html#|archive-date=7 October 2017|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> determined to see the campaign out and ultimately captaining the club to promotion back to the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/05/07/newcastle-crowned-championship-winners-late-jack-grealish-aston/|title=Newcastle crowned Championship winners after late Jack Grealish Aston Villa equaliser halts Brighton|newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=7 May 2017|accessdate=6 October 2017 | first=Luke | last=Edwards}}</ref> His solid performances at the beginning of the [[2017-18 in English football|2017–18]] season led to him being nominated for the September [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jamaal-lascelles-nominated-premier-league-13726023|title=Jamaal Lascelles nominated for Premier League Player of the month – here's how you can vote for him|publisher=The Chronicle|date=6 October 2017|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref> which was eventually won by [[Harry Kane]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/tottenham-hotspur/story/3227872/tottenhams-harry-kane-wins-premier-league-player-of-the-month|title=Tottenham's Harry Kane wins Premier League Player of the Month|last=Kilpatrick|first=Dan|website=ESPN|access-date=13 October 2017}}</ref> On 6 October 2017, he signed a new six-year contract with Newcastle, keeping him at the club until 2023.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41529463|title=Jamaal Lascelles: Newcastle United captain signs new contract until 2023|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 October 2017|accessdate=6 October 2017}}</ref>
In October 2017, he had a training ground fight with teammate [[Mohamed Diamé]]. The two players later apologised and offered to take the entire first-team squad and staff out for lunch.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/10/13/newcastle-pair-say-sorry-training-ground-fight-offer-whole-squad/|title=Newcastle pair say sorry for the training-ground fight and offer the whole squad a free lunch|date=13 October 2017|publisher=|via=www.telegraph.co.uk}}</ref>
In October 2018 he signed a new contract until 2024.<ref>https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46057167</ref>
==International career== Lascelles has represented England at all youth international levels from [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]] to [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]].<ref name="The FA – Jamaal Lascelles">{{cite web| title = The FA – Jamaal Lascelles| url = http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/L/Jamaal%20Lascelles| publisher = The Football Association| accessdate = 9 March 2012}}</ref>
On 28 May 2013, he was named in manager [[Peter Taylor (footballer, born 1953)|Peter Taylor]]'s 21-man squad for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].<ref>[https://archive.is/20130615071407/http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/u20s-world-cup-squad-announcement-280513 "Final squad named"]. The Football Association. 28 May 2013. Retrieved 17 June 2013.</ref> He made his debut on 16 June, in a 3–0 win in a warm-up game against [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay]].<ref>[https://archive.is/20130624222816/http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u20s/News/2013/uruguay-report-160613 "Training win for Three Lions"]. The Football Association. 16 June 2013. Retrieved 17 June 2013.</ref>
On 27 February 2014, Lascelles received his first [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] call-up for the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification Group 1|2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualifying]] match against [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Nottingham Forest defender Jamaal Lascelles gets first England under-21 call up|url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/Nottingham-Forest-defender-Jamaal-Lascelles-gets/story-20718559-detail/story.html|accessdate=4 August 2014|newspaper=Nottingham Post|date=27 February 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140317062006/http://www.nottinghampost.com/Nottingham-Forest-defender-Jamaal-Lascelles-gets/story-20718559-detail/story.html|archive-date=17 March 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=England Under-21s name 23-man squad for game with Wales|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/under-21/2014/feb/squad-named-for-wales-at-derby-270214|publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=4 August 2014|date=27 February 2014}}</ref> He made his debut, and only under-21 appearance, starting in the qualifying match against [[Moldova national under-21 football team|Moldova]] on 9 September 2014.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Veevers|first1=Nicholas|title=Saido Berahino brace helps England prevail in Moldova|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/under-21/2014/sep/moldova-report-090914|publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=9 September 2014|date=9 September 2014}}</ref>
